repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits.

summary.p: The Tirumurukāṟṟuppaṭai is a devotional poem, dated possibly to the 7th century of the Common Era, in praise of the Tamil god Murukaṉ. The poem, attributed to Nakkīrar, belongs to the Caṅkam corpus and to the Tamil Śaiva canonical works (Tirumuṟai).
The manuscript contains the commentary by Nacciṉārkkiṉiyar. The root-text is quoted in the commentary, that the text and the commentary are interspersed.
Description based on the examination of the original (November 2011). Updated with the digital images available on Gallica.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Title Page (additional). No foliation. Double folio. Shelfmark on recto. Hand #1. With shelfmark: C/22.
36 folios = Tirumurukāṟṟuppaṭai: Text & Commentary (interspersed). No foliation. Tamil filiation {1}-36. Commentary by Nacciṉārkkiṉiyar. Hand #2. 6 lines per page.
1 folio = guard leaf. No foliation. Double folio. Kampar taṉippāṭal on recto, by hand #3; ownership statement on verso, by hand #4.

supportDesc.condition: Relatively good state of preservation, in spite of boreholes caused by insects.

additions.p: Marginal benedictions; title-page; marginal chapter headers (original ones crossed-out, while others, later added, are not blackened with soot); colophon; ownership statement; addenda: benedictions (U1, f[1]r, rm); 1 Kampar taṉippāṭal (U5: f[1]r).
additions.desc: BnF bequest sticker DON N° (front cover, recto).
BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 67 (front cover, recto).

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

origin.origDate: Internally dated to the year cupāṉu of the Jovian cycle, that is, CE 1823-1824, 1763-1764, 1703-1704, etc. See colophon U3, f36r4. Dated to 1763 by Vinson (1868) on the basis of the colophon. Not dated by Cabaton (1912).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192. Legs d'Édouard Ariel.

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

listBibl.bibl: Tirumurukaṟṟuppaṭai 1956. In: pattuppāṭṭu mūlamum maturaiyāciriyar pārattuvāci nacciṉārkkiṉiyaruraiyum. Ed. by U. Vē. Cāminātaiyar. Ceṉṉai: kapīr accukkūṭam.
Cabaton, Antoine (1912). Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris : E. Leroux. — See p. 14, n0. 67.
Rosny, Léon de (1868). La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry. Dans : Variétés orientales (p. 177-224). Paris : Maisonneuve.
Vinson, Julien (1868). Catalogue des manuscrits tamouls. Corrected proofreadings printed by the atelier oriental de l’Imprimerie nationale. BnF “4-IMPROR-77 (B)” — See p. 21, no. 67.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
